info.name: SmartZone High Scale
info.description:
Pre-Requisites

The following instructions assume you have the following components:
-	one vSZ-High Scale instance running 5.2.0.0.699 or later;
-	one access point onboarded into the vSZ staging zone;

Instructions

Edit the attribute values for the API call "1. Get service ticket" to match with your vSZ instance:
-	change the IP address in the Pre-request Script
-	change the credentials in the Body

Check if if system clock in your vSZ instance matches the clock in your computer. Make the necessary adjustments (sync the NTP server or change the time zone), otherwise the API calls that are time-dependent (ex: "15. Get wireless application traffic") will not return the correct values.

Send the API call "1. Get service ticket" to obtain the authentication token.

Send each of the subsequent API calls in the order which they appear.

After you execute all calls, clean you vSZ instance by executing all API calls under the Delete objects folder,  in the order which they appear.

Notes

After the WLANs are created, use different clients to connect to the WPA WLAN and to the Captive Portal WLAN
There is a bug in the SZ GUI. After the API call "10. Add application policy to WPA wlan" is executed, you need to open the WLAN configuration twice to see the change at Firewall Options/Application Policy.

For more information about this collection please contact marcelo.molinari@commscope.com

request.description: Includes hostname, serial number and model number

body.raw:
{
    "domainId": "{{parentDomainID}}",
    "name": "WebRL",
    "description": "",
    "defaultAction": "ALLOW",
    "qmAppPolicyId": "",
    "appPolicyId": "",
    "urlFilteringPolicyId": "",
    "ipAclRules": [
        {
            "priority": 1,
            "description": "Allow DNS",
            "enableSourceIpSubnet": true,
            "enableDestinationIpSubnet": true,
            "enableSourcePortRange": true,
            "enableDestinationPortRange": false,
            "destinationMinPort": 53,
            "action": "ALLOW",
            "ipType": "IPv4",
            "direction": "UPSTREAM"
        },
        {
            "priority": 2,
            "description": "Allow DHCP",
            "enableSourceIpSubnet": true,
            "enableDestinationIpSubnet": true,
            "enableSourcePortRange": true,
            "enableDestinationPortRange": false,
            "destinationMinPort": 67,
            "action": "ALLOW",
            "ipType": "IPv4",
            "direction": "UPSTREAM"
        }
    ],
    "uplinkRateLimiting": {
        "uplinkRateLimitingEnabled": true,
        "uplinkRateLimitingBps": "11 mbps"
    },
    "downlinkRateLimiting": {
        "downlinkRateLimitingEnabled": true,
        "downlinkRateLimitingBps": "12 mbps"
    }
}

item.name: 10. Apply user traffic policy to WPA wlan

request.description:
Use this request to change the Firewall Profile
Use two type of Firewall Profile: one for RL and another for Application
Then, you can use request 10. Configure Firewall profile to change the RL profile, and request 11. Configure Application policy to change the Application profile

item.name: 10. Add application policy to WPA wlan
